item.title: Morrisons agrees to raised £6.7bn takeover offer from Fortress
item.description: The new £6.7bn bid for the supermarket from Fortress comes amid rumours of a rival offer from another US firm.

item.title: Energy bills to rise by at least £139 for millions of households
item.description: Fuel poverty charities say the price cap increase will come at the worst time during winter.

item.title: US economy adds more jobs than expected in July
item.description: US employers added 943,000 jobs in July, while the unemployment rate fell to 5.4%.

item.title: House price growth slows as housing market cools
item.description: The Halifax says house prices rose again in July, but the market seems to be cooling down.

item.title: South Park creators sign $900m deal to make seasons and movies
item.description: The agreement comes as technology and media giants battle to dominate the global streaming market.

item.title: Starter salaries rising amid candidate shortages
item.description: KPMG research shows now is a good time to be looking for a job, due to high demand from employers.

item.title: Amazon delays office return until 2022 as Covid spreads
item.description: Amazon joins Wells Fargo and BlackRock in extending work-from-home guidance due to the pandemic.

item.title: Bukalapak: Shares jump in Indonesia's biggest market debut
item.description: It comes on the same day South Korea's first internet lender KakaoBank soared on its market debut in Seoul.

item.title: Apple to scan iPhones for child sex abuse images
item.description: Apple announces it will implement a system to scan US iPhones for images of child sexual abuse.

item.title: Oatly loses trademark battle against Glebe Farm over oat milk
item.description: Cambridgeshire's Glebe Farm Foods PureOaty drink does not copy the Oatly branding, a judge rules.

item.title: Inflation rise will be temporary, says Bank governor Bailey
item.description: Bank of England's Andrew Bailey says rising inflation is understandable given a "bumpy" economic recovery.

item.title: Sports Direct's Mike Ashley to hand reins to future son-in-law
item.description: The tycoon, whose empire also includes House of Fraser and Evans Cycles, is set to hand power to his future son-in-law.

item.title: Coronavirus: PM and transport secretary defend travel changes
item.description: British tourists in Mexico who are due back after Sunday's deadline will need to decide whether to come home early to avoid quarantining.

item.title: Cat death rise: 'It feels like we've lost a family member'
item.description: As cat deaths mount from a fatal disease, an investigation into a possible link to pet food continues.

item.title: Plain sailing: Boating holidays on the rise across the UK
item.description: More people are hiring boats to travel along the UK's canals and rivers amid travel restrictions.

item.title: CEO Secrets: Airbnb boss shares his business advice
item.description: Brian Chesky, co-founder and CEO of Airbnb, shares his business advice for the CEO Secrets series.

item.title: The downfall of Nissan's Carlos Ghosn: An insider's view
item.description: Former Nissan lawyer Ravinder Passi had a ringside seat of the downfall of chairman Carlos Ghosn.

item.title: What is solarpunk and can it help save the planet?
item.description: Solarpunk is art movement that imagines a world where technology is used for the good of the planet.

item.title: The collapse of Enron and the dark side of business
item.description: Twenty years on from the collapse of Enron, are the rules preventing corporate fraud tough enough?

item.title: Finding answers to the world's drinking water crisis
item.description: Scientists are racing to come up with technologies that can solve the world's clean water shortage.
